ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Interface LineDetectorController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DifferentialLineDetector, PDifferentialLineDetector, ProportionalLineDetector

    public interface LineDetectorController
    A class that implements LineDetectorController should use a single color sensor in order to detect lines. The LineDetectorController interface provides two methods for detecting lines. Either detecting a full line, or detecting an edge. The interface also contains two methods for determining the location of the most recent edge. The interface has one last method that is used to process the light value that was detected.
    Author:
    Matthew

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  LineDetectorController.Edge
      The Edge enum contains the 3 different possible returns of the edgeDetected method.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LineDetectorController.Edge edgeDetected()
      Determines if an edge has been detected, and returns an Edge value depending on what was detected.
      double getEdgeX()
      Finds the X location of the last detected edge.
      double getEdgeY()
      Finds the Y location of the last detected edge.
      boolean lineDetected()
      Determines if a line has been detected.
      double processCSData(double lightVal)
      Interprets a light value depending on the chosen implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • lineDetected

        boolean lineDetected()
        Determines if a line has been detected.
        Returns:
        true if a line has been detected.

      • edgeDetected

        LineDetectorController.Edge edgeDetected()
        Determines if an edge has been detected, and returns an Edge value depending on what was detected.
        Returns:
        Either a rising edge or falling edge if either were detected, or NoEdge.

      • processCSData

        double processCSData(double lightVal)
        Interprets a light value depending on the chosen implementation.
        Parameters:
        lightVal - the most recent light value detected
        Returns:
        the processed data

      • getEdgeX

        double getEdgeX()
        Finds the X location of the last detected edge.
        Returns:
        X location in cm

      • getEdgeY

        double getEdgeY()
        Finds the Y location of the last detected edge.
        Returns:
        Y location in cm
